thread.title: Photo essay: Maine's Acadia National Park and its sunrise-watchers
thread.title_full: Photo essay: Maine's Acadia National Park and its sunrise-watchers

title: Photo essay: Maine's Acadia National Park and its sunrise-watchers
text:
By Matt McClain, Washington Post Sunrise-watchers last October at Acadia National Park in Bar Harbor, on Mount Desert Island, Maine. Photograph by: Matt McClain , The Washington Post 
On a brisk October morning, people gather in the pre-dawn hours as the sky begins to brighten. Wearing heavy jackets and bundled tight with blankets, they struggle against cold, windy weather that makes it feel more like winter than fall. 
Spreading out across a rocky mountaintop, they take part in the tradition that is observing the sunrise in Maineâ€™s vast Acadia National Park . 
Its 47,000 acres, with their sharply hewn coastline and pristine woods, take up much of Mount Desert Island , and those who make the pilgrimage up
